items.sentence: I don't even want to be around people who do things like that.
I saw Tom walking down Park Street in the middle of the night.
Tom used to go to church every Sunday, but he doesn't anymore.
My alarm clock didn't go off this morning, so I missed my bus.
The fire had already gone out by the time the firemen arrived.
You're speaking too quietly for me to hear what you're saying.
Tom became the breadwinner of the family when his father died.
Tom's ill-informed financial decisions nearly led to his ruin.
The boar has already killed several hunters who got too close.
Have you found the umbrella you said you'd lost the other day?
Tom won't be able to walk home today. He's sprained his ankle.
I don't understand why I need to go to your house at midnight.
The solution to that problem was more difficult than expected.
I tell everybody that I can't speak French, even though I can.
Tom bought flowers for his girlfriend, but not for his mother.
Tom said something to me in French that I couldn't understand.
I won't be as busy tomorrow as I'll be the day after tomorrow.
Tom complained to his landlord that the heater wasn't working.
Do you have any idea how much money you spend a month on food?
Your ideas are old-fashioned and won't work in the real world.
